dcterms:description: The Good Gestalt (GG) datasets are a collection of six datasets designed to test perceptual grouping principles such as illusory contours, closure, continuity, proximity, and occlusion.
dcterms:title: Good Gestalt (GG) datasets

dcterms:creator: G. Kanizsa
dcterms:description: The Kanizsa Squares dataset is used to study the perception of illusory figures, where humans can perceive illusory contours created by Pacman-like circles.
dcterms:title: Kanizsa Squares

dcterms:creator: J. R. Pomerantz
L. C. Sager
R. J. Stoever
dcterms:description: The Closure dataset studies the ability to combine individual image elements to form a complete object, focusing on the perception of closed figures.
dcterms:title: Closure

dcterms:creator: I. Kov√°cs
B. Julesz
dcterms:description: The Continuity dataset examines how humans integrate individual elements across the visual field to perceive continuous objects.
dcterms:title: Continuity

dcterms:creator: M. Kubovy
M. van den Berg
dcterms:description: The Proximity dataset investigates how the distance between elements influences their grouping, focusing on the cue of intra-element distance.
dcterms:title: Proximity

dcterms:creator: P. J. Kellman
E. S. Spelke
dcterms:description: The Gradient Occlusion dataset studies the perception of objects that are partially occluded, focusing on how humans perceive occluded elements.
dcterms:title: Gradient Occlusion

dcterms:creator: G. W. Lesher
dcterms:description: The Illusory Occlusion dataset examines how humans group elements across the visual field when occluded by illusory objects.
dcterms:title: Illusory Occlusion
